message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses data from the Global Findex Database to analyze the relationship between financial inclusion and household welfare in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Global Findex Database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the LSMS-ISA in Uganda, this paper examines the impact of climate change on household welfare outcomes, including food security and asset ownership.", "dataset": ["LSMS-ISA"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize a unique dataset combining geospatial and socioeconomic data from a survey conducted in Brazil to assess the spatial distribution of accessibility to various urban services.", "dataset": ["geospatial and socioeconomic data from a survey conducted in Brazil"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Spatial Analysis"]}, {"sentence": "This paper draws on a longitudinal dataset of firms in India to examine the determinants of firm performance, taking into account factors such as innovation, export behavior, and managerial characteristics.", "dataset": ["longitudinal dataset of firms in India"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from multiple sources - including satellite images and ground-based measurements - to estimate the spatiotemporal variability of soil moisture in the Congo Basin.", "dataset": ["satellite images", "ground-based measurements"], "topic": ["Environment", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) in multiple African countries, we investigate the link between women's empowerment and child nutrition outcomes, controlling for a variety of demographic and economic factors.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Gender", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This study explores the use of machine learning techniques to analyze data from a large-scale survey of households in Mexico, with the goal of predicting credit risk and improving financial inclusion.", "dataset": ["large-scale survey of households in Mexico"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Machine Learning"]}, {"sentence": "We use a panel dataset on Chinese prefectures to examine the impact of infrastructure investment on regional economic growth, taking into account spatial spillovers and heterogeneity across regions.", "dataset": ["panel dataset on Chinese prefectures"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Macroeconomics", "Spatial Analysis"]}, {"sentence": "This article uses satellite data on nighttime lights and electrical power outages to estimate the extent of energy access deficits in sub-Saharan Africa, and to identify patterns of both urban and rural electrification.", "dataset": ["satellite data on nighttime lights and electrical power outages"], "topic": ["Energy", "Rural Development"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on data from both the World Values Survey and the European Social Survey to explore the relationship between trust in government and citizen participation in diverse contexts, assessing whether this relationship varies across different social groups.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "European Social Survey"], "topic": ["Governance", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}]
